intro: Guatteria calva, commonly known as the white guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and avocado trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and have a smooth, glossy surface. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in inflorescences, and it produces edible, yellowish fruits that are about 2-3 centimeters in diameter. Guatteria calva is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
